text:
(1) Watchogue Road, west side, north of Victory Boulevard, showing the Blake House, a colonial structure. It was, at one time, inhabited by Daniel Blake, once police captain, who was a grandson of William W. Blake, of Revolutionary times.

1924.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A distant view of the rear of the house, at a later date.

September 26, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A distant view of the rear of the house, at a later date.

September 26, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.

Jewett Avenue, east side, about 300 yards north of Victory Boulevard, showing the remains of iron mines, at one time operated by the Richmond Iron Mining Company (Beers's 1874 map).

P.L.Sperr

Views 1 & 3: April 28, 1927
View 2: 1924

Jewett Avenue, east side, about 300 yards north of Victory Boulevard, showing the remains of iron mines, at one time operated by the Richmond Iron Mining Company (Beers's 1874 map).

P.L.Sperr

Views 1 & 3: April 28, 1927

View 2: 1924

Victory Boulevard, adjoining the N.E. corner of Jewett Avenue. The maps from 1874 to 1907 show the house to have belonged to W. Kirk. It was owned by Jos. M. Hoffmann in 1917.

April 25, 1929

P. L. Sperr
